inn1.comm: squares him up with a straight delivery that pitches on middle and leg and moves away, he plays with soft hands and picks up one that shoots towards gully
another straight delivery on the stumps, nothing fancy, not trying too much, keeps it tight and Jayasuriya defends coming half forward
this one's on a good length on middle and leg, Jayasuriya gets over it in an attempt to work it to leg, but gets caught in the stroke and has to defend

quicker, shorter and going down leg stump, Jayasuriya swivels on the clip and tickles it around the corner to McCullum, off the gloves, its a clear one and they all go up, but the umpire is unmoved. Jayasuriya gets a life early! What a wicket that would have been!
fuller, but just a tad, and its pushed to mid-off for a sharp single
short of a good length on leg stump, he works that off the hips to short fine leg, who doesnt quite get to it, and they complete two runs easily
good start, pitches on a good length outside off, swings away, and sucks Jayasuriya into a tame push
a tad fuller and Jayasuriya gets right on top of it, pushing to mid-off, Tharanga wants the run but he's sent back
quicker delivery on a length, pitches on middle and off, Jayasuriya tries to work it to leg but gets all tangled up, there was a second noise there, an inside edge in most cases

gone! Bowled! This one pitches short of a good length on middle and leg, Jayasuriya's quickly into position to pull but again gets all tangled up, and the result is that he chops onto the base of leg stump, and he's a goner!

quick delivery moving down leg stump, Jayawardene stands and tries to run it fine, ball clips the top of the hip guard en route to McCullum, and they all go up in appeal, but thats clearly not got any bat on it
super delivery, on a good length outside off stump and rising, drawing him into the backfoot prod on his toes, and he's beaten, but just
good ball, pitches on a sweet length outside off and angles past his bat, he plays well inside it and gets beaten
beaten again! This one's fuller outside off stump, but his feet go nowhere and he's suckered into a tame reach at it, and misses
this one's straighter on leg stump, and he just taps that into mid-wicket for an easy single
quick, short of a length delivery outside off stump, pitches and rears off the seam and Jayawardene thinks about a shot but holds back at the nth second
good length outside off stump, up on the toes goes Jayawardene and defends comfortably
he oversteps, its a good ball, standing up outside off and forcing Jayawardene to defend stoically off the toes again, but a run still
full on leg stump, and Jayawardene just flicks it over mid-wicket for four, easy pickings if you bowl there to a batsman like him
good, seaming delivery on a full length outside off stump, Tharanga shoulders arms confidently, but his off stump was exposed
quick again, just a foot or so behind where it pitched last ball, but its an easy leave for Tharanga
fuller on off stump, Tharanga gets forward and pushes through the line, timing it nicely past Vettori at mid-off, who gives chase and hauls it in near the ropes
back of a good length outside off stump, Tharanga stands and defends compactly
short of a good length outside off stump, Tharanga pokes at it away from his body, and gets an edge that shoots past gully down to third man for one
full, away-swinging ball outside off stump, he gets to the pitch of it and shoulders arms
back of a good length delivery outside off stump, Tharanga pushes off the back foot to Vettori at mid-off, and calls for the quick single, gets it in the end

cleaned him up! Full, swinging delivery outside off stump, nips in off the seam and Jayawardene just stands there and drives at it, closing the face of the bat, and the ball scoots past off the inside edge onto off stump
bad ball, too short outside leg stump, overexcitement perhaps, and McCullum takes it, thats a wide
back of a good length on middle and off, Sangakkara gets behind and looks to work it to leg, but ends up defending loosely back to Gillespie
too full outside off stump, and thats a nice-looking forward drive past a diving Vettori at mid-off for four, good way to open your account
good length outside off stump, Sangakkara gets behind the line and defends into the covers
another good length delivery outside off stump, this time he's late getting the bat down on it, but all's well
good length on off stump, Tharanga defends with one hand, but he's played it softly and picks up one as it rolls past gully
good, seaming delivery outside off stump, Sangakkara thinks about defending but pulls the bat back late as it moves past him
identical delivery, this one has a little more swing on it, and Sangakkara gets a good look at it and leaves it alone
fuller and wider this time, he gets his front foot out and leaves it alone
fuller and closer to off stump, Sangakkara is confident of where it is though and shoulders arms
this time he gets it closer to off stump, and Sangakkara has to bring the bat down quickly, and keeps it down to gully
full outside off stump, Tharanga lunges forward and gets beaten by one that angles across him, not a lot of seam movement but a good angle on that ball
this one goes down leg stump, and he works it off the pads down to McMillan at fine leg
a bouncer! Lands on middle and off and moves across him, and Sangakkara thinks about the pull but the ball follows him and pulls out as it sails over his head

not this time! Another one is banged in short on middle and leg, doesnt stand up as much as the previous one, and Sangakkara swivels into position, pulling superbly past square leg, the ball bounces just short of the ropes
short of a good length on middle and leg, Sangakkara works it to square leg, where Adams dives fullstretch to his left and stops it
fullish outside leg stump, he's beaten for pace looking to flick, they all go up with the question, but the umpire shakes his head, a good shout but marginally outside the line
too full and wide outside off stump, Tharanga thinks about flashing the blade at it but holds off
straighter on off stump, Tharanga drops the bat and the ball rolls to point
full and wide outside off stump, tempting him into the drive, but he opts to watch it into McCullum's gloves
short of a length outside off stump, again we see Tharanga drive with one hand off the bat, but he manages to place it just to the left of mid-off for a quick single

banged in short, Sangakkara swivels into the pull shot but gets under it, the ball was in the air for a long time, fine leg moves around quickly but the ball lands well before he gets there, pitching just inside the ropes and carrying over, streaky shot that
full and swinging outside off stump, Sangakkara comes forward and fishes at it, and gets beaten. good ball to end the over
full outside off stump, Tharanga drives to Vettori at mid-off
pitches just short of being a half-volley outside off stump, and Tharanga just drives that nicely, though on the up, in between cover and mid-off for four
good ball, swings across his forward prod and squares him up, and he's beaten all ends up
pitches outside leg stump, thats a wide
back of a good length outside off stump, pushed into the covers
straighter on middle and off, squares him up again and he defends
pitches on a good length on middle and off, and nearly cuts him in half as he stands and plays at it, again taking one hand off the bat. That ball just missed clipping the top of middle stump
short of a good length outside off stump, Sangakkara stands tall and cracks that off the back foot straight to point
good length outside off stump, he stands and defends to James Marshall at cover
another good length delivery outside off stump, again defended to cover
good delivery outside off stump again, and he watchfully defends to cover with a firm 'NOOOO' back to his partner, looking good

too short on middle and leg, he's quickly into position to pull, times it superbly, getting right over the ball, but Adams covers good ground on the ropes and dives to his left to cut it off before it reaches the ropes
fullish on middle and leg, driven to mid-on
and he starts with a long hop which Sangakkara coolly dispatches to the deep square leg ropes with a terrific pull shot
straighter but too much on middle and leg, and its easily worked past mid-wicket for a brace
full outside off stump, Sangakkara drives but gets an inside edge to the off side
good length outside off stump, Sangakkara gets right behind it and defends back to Franklin
a fraction shorter outside off stump, giving him the room to free the arms, but he;s slow in getting the bat down and ends up chopping it into the ground
back of a good length outside off stump, he's right behind the line and defends back to Franklin
bangs in a short one, and Tharanga gets down on his haunches
short again, but in a flash he's on the backfoot and smacks that off the middle of the bat, pulling superbly down to fine leg for four, smashed!
short again, and this time Tharanga pulls over mid-wicket for four more to bring up Sri Lanka's 50, good stuff this

gone this time! He pushes in one on a good length outside off stump, the corridor of uncertainty, as they say, and Tharanga plays away from the body looking for the cut, and the result is a thick edge into the lap of Ross Taylor at first slip! Mason has his revenge!
and he's welcomed with a bounces outside off stump, and he ducks down
good length outside off stump, Atapattu hops and defends with bat and pad together
good length outside off stump, Sangakkara shoulders arms
SHOT! Half-volley well outside off stump, down on bended knee goes Sangakkara with an excellent square-drive for four
good length outside off stump, nips in sharply and Sangakkara defends it
straighter delivery on off stump, pushed to mid-on

too full again, and Sangakkara unfirls a classy drive to mid-off, where Vettori takes two steps to his right, dives, and fires in the throw to McCullum, who whips off the bails, Sangakkara seemed to be strolling back in his crease, but the third umpire rules him back in safely
full again, and this time he drives on one knee but gets an inside edge
full and wide outside off stump, Atapattu watches it through to McCullum
fullish, defended off the front foot to covers
good length outside off stump, Atapattu defends to the off side
a tad fuller this time, and he gets on top of it and defends to covers
bangs in a shorter one that sails over his left shoulder, and he gets down quickly
great ball! Pitches on a good length and shapes past Atapattu's backfoot defence
good length outside off stump, Atapattu defends getting his head down
full outside off stump, Sangakkara drives to Vettori at mid-off
quicker delivery outside off stump, pitches on a good length and moves in, Sangakkara gets on top of it and defends to the on side
fuller this time, Sangakkara gets on top of it and presents the full face of the bat to Marshall at cover
short on middle and off, he pulls but doesnt time it that well, ends up with one as short fine leg moves around quickly
good length ball moves across him, but he's on top of it and defends to covers with a 'NO, WAIT' back to Sangakkara
full and wide, Atapattu flashes the drive away from his body and gets a thick edge safely in the gap at gully for one to third man, and he's off the mark
full on middle and leg, striving for the yorker, but Atapattu gets on top of it and flicks in the gap at mid-wicket, the ball picks up speed and wins the race to the ropes
back of a good length outside off stump, Atapattu gets up on the toes and pushes it in the gap at cover, McMillan and Hamish Marshall give chase and the tag-team effort keep the runs down to three
fullish outside off stump, Sangakkara judges it and shoulders arms
back of a good length on off stump, he gets behind it and rolls the wrists, but cant beat mid-wicket
too full on the legs, and he flicks nicely out to Hamish Marshall at deep backward square leg
bounces him down the leg stump, Atapattu ducks out of harm's way
fullish delivery outside the off stump, Sangakkara gets forward and pushes it straight to the fielder at short cover
too full outside off stump, Sangakkara gets onto one knee and drives into the covers, but Fulton pulls off a great stop diving to his left
back of a good length outside off stump, Sangakkara stands and runs that along the ground to gully
good length angled across him, he defends to point
full outside off stump, he drives, taking one hand off the bat, and picks up one to third man courtesy the outer edge
dropped short outside off stump, Sangakkara flashes the bat at it, and picks up four over backward point
full outside off stump, Atapattu judges it well and leaves it alone
drifts to leg stump and Atapattu works it around the corner for one
short of a good length outside off stump, Sangakkara uses the soft hands to run it to backward point, they think about the run but resist
back of a good length outside off stump again, and he moves across and chops it to point
luverly! Half-volley outside off stump, onto one knee goes Sangakkara, and square-drives superbly past cover-point for four more
straighter one this time, he gets behind the line and pushes back to Adams
fullish outside off stump, Atapattu drives through the covers, sweeper cuts if off on the ropes, but thats three still
shorter this time, on a good length, forcing Sangakkara to flay the bat at it and gets beaten
back of a length delivery on the off, Sangakkara goes on the backfoot and plays it back to the bowler
too full and moving down leg stump, and Sangakkara flicks well down to fine leg for four, placed in the gap
back of a length on leg stump, worked into mid-wicket for one
fullish outside off stump, he shoulders arms
fullish outside off stump, Sangakkara comes forward and pushes uppishly to Vettori at mid-off
good length outside off stump, moves in a tad and forces Sangakkara to manifacture a wristy work to leg, but he cant time it well enough, and ends up defending
full outside off stump, he shoulders arms
short of a good length outside off stump, Sangakkara cracks it off the backfoot to James Marshall at cover, his twin Hamish is at backward point
good length outside off stump, Sangakkara gets up and defends back to Adams

a fraction wider, this time Sangakkara brings the bat down like a rapier and slashes to Hamish M at backward point, who doesnt take it cleanly, not a dropped catch by any means though, ball landed before him
tossed up outside off stump, Atapattu comes forward and presents the full face of the bat
flatter and moving down leg, Atapattu tries a deft flick but gets beaten
tossed up outside the line of off stump, drifts in and catches Atapattu on the pad, there's an appeal but there was also doubt in the umpire's mind
tossed up outside off stump, Atapattu comes down and drives, but mid-off dives well and saves runs
quicker and flatter on leg stump, worked to square leg for one
flat outside off stump, Sangakkara makes room and guides to point, Hamish M throws it back at Atapattu's end, he's halfway down the track but makes it back and the throw is wayward
good length delivery outside off stump, Atapattu gets forward and drops the soft hands on it for a quick single, good running between the wickets
fuller on leg stump, worked fine for one more&
back of a length delivery down leg, Atapattu goes on the backfoot and looks to pull it away, inside edges it to short fine leg, off the glove it looks like
full and wide, Sangakkara mistimes the square-drive in the air, but in the gap between gully and point, and picks up one
fuller outside off stump, Atapattu opens the face of the bat and slices it to square third man for a single
fuller outside off stump, he pushes it to point and thinks about the run, but resists
tossed up outside off stump, Atapattu defends to cover
tossed up on leg stump, it drifts down and Atapattu sweeps, misses, there's a loud appeal but the umpire's not interested
flatter outside off stump, Atapattu gets a step down and smashes it back in the air but its too far to Vettori's left, he dives but cant get a hand to it
quicker and flatter on leg stump, worked to mid-wicket for one
back of a length delivery angling in and Atapattu goes backfoot and flicks it straight to the fielder at short mid-wicket
tossed up outside off stump, Atapattu opens the face of the bat and steers it to point
good length on middle and leg, Sangakkara works it straight to mid-wicket
fuller outside off stump, Sangakkara gets down on one knee and square-drives that uppishly past a diving Hamish M at backward point

a chance goes begging! Banged in on a short length on off stump, Atapattu was in no position to pull that but he does anyways, the ball bobs up in the air down the ground, Vettori at mid-off sprints a few paces to his left, but the balls moving down and dying on him, he dives but cant get to it, a close call
short of a length delivery outside off stump, Sangakkara goes on the backfoot and cuts it to point
fuller length delivery outside off stump, Sangakkara reaches for it and drives it straight to Hamish M at point
fullish outside off stump, Sangakkara opens the face of the bat and steers it down to third man for a couple
tossed up outside off stump, Atapattu plants the foot down and heaves across the line, timing the slog-sweep well in the gap at mid-wicket and picks up four, aggression now from Atapattu!

bowled him, sweet revenge! Vettori tosses in the arm ball marginally outside off stump, it pitches on a good length and scoots in between Atapattu's tame back-foot drive and castles into off stump! That was a useless shot, you'd have to say, he was neither here nor there, and pays the price
quicker and flatter outside off stump, Silva lunges forward and gets rapped on the front leg, Vettori lets out a loud appeal but the umpire shakes his head
tossed up outside off stump, Silva comes forward and runs it to backward point
quicker on middle and off, Silva tries to play it out in front of his pads but doesnt time it well
flatter and quicker outside off stump, Silva gets behind it and defends
short of a length ball outside off stump, cut down to third man for a single
good length ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler
steered to point for a single, Silva is off the mark
wide outside off stump, left alone
defended on the off side
pushed to cover point for a single to end the over
floated through the air on leg and middle stump, defended on the front foot back to the bowler
width offered this time and Sangakkara cashes in by cutting to deep point, he scampers through for two and brings up his fifty, excellent innings, he's been in outstanding form on this tour
pushed behind square leg for a single
Silva gives Vettori the charge but is miles away from the pitch of the ball and ends up padding it away
worked off the pads to square leg for a single

whoops, Sangakkara shaped up to play a pull, well a sort of pull, the ball wasn't short enough and he wasn't in position, he gets a top edge over short third man, lucky break for that coudl have gone anywhere
inside edge on to pad, they steal a sharp sigle
fullish length but drifting on to leg stump, flicked off the pads for an easy single to fine leg
good length ball angling into Sangakkara's middle stump from round the wicket, dabbed towards cover for a single
steered past point for another single
full ball on off stump, Sangakkara gets forward and punches to mid-off
excellent length on off stump, pushing Sangakkara on to the back foot, he dabs it towards point looking for the single but doesn't find it
Silva gives Vettori the charge but once again he isn't to the pitch of the ball, however, he uses the room to cut to deep point
beaten outside the off stump, McCullum whips off the bails but the batsman never left his crease
cut to third man for two more
fullish ball on the pads, flicked behind square for one
tight line and length on off and middle stump, Silva stays in his crease and defends
pushed to point on the front foot
starts witha  loud appeal but that pitched outside leg stump, angled across Sangakkara and hit him high on the pad, optimistic shout
good length ball pitching on middle and off stump, defended on the back foot to point
fuller length on middle and leg stump, worked off the pads through midwicket for a single
pitches outside off stump and moves a shade away from Silva who opens the face in an attempt to run it down to third man, the ball sneaks past the outside edge
and immeaditely Silva plonks his front foot forward, opens the face and runs it through where gully would have been
short of a length delivery on the pads, Sangakkara goes on the backfoot and flicks through midwicket for a single
defended to midwicket
tight line, no room at all for the batsman, driven back to the bowler
pitches on off stump and holds it's line, Sangakkara plays for turn on the back foot and gets an outside edge behind point for one
swept to deep square leg for a single
pushed to midwicket on the front foot
played to long-on for a single to end the over
defended to point on the back foot
excellent ball, pitched short of a length outside off stump and rose sharply on Silva who weaved out of the way
fuller ball on middle and leg stump, Silva leans forward and defends to midwicket

short of a length ball outside off stump, Silva jumps on the back foot and pushes to cover, Silva sets off for a quick single, James Marshall swoops down on it and hits the stumps at the bowler's end, Silva is safe

pushed to point and Silva calls for a dangerous run, Hamish Marshall screams in from point, picks up one handed and shies at the stumps, he misses but Silva would have been safe, superb running but a tad too risky
short of a length delivery on the middle and leg, Silva goes on the backfoot and glances it to square leg
full ball drifting on to pad, flicked through midwicket for one
good length ball on middle adn off, Sangakkara plays back and defends, the ball takes the outside edge wide of point for one
tossed up ball on off stump, Silva uses his feet well to get to the pitch and drives down to long-on for one
defended to short fine leg
pushed wide of point on the front foot for a single
full ball on leg stump, Vettori bowled that from wide of the crease from round the wicket, Silva is quick to get down on one knee and sweep to long leg for a single to end the over
pitches on middle and off, angling across the left-hander, Sangakkara pushes forward and th inside edge runs behind square leg for one, McCullum scampers across to field
defended to point, loud call of "NO!" from Silva
short of a length ball outside of stump, Silva stands tall, gets on top of it and cuts to point
full length ball on off stump, Silva gets forward and drives to deep cover
short of a length ball on leg and middle stump, Sangakkara plays back and whips it off his hips for a single to deep backward square leg
pinged in short and that soars over Silva's head, it's correctly called a wide
fuller ball angling into off and middle stump, Silva tries to drive to long-on but doesn't time it well
delivery tossed up on the middle and leg, Sangakkara shuffles across and defends to square leg
fullish delivery on the leg, Sangakkara steps down and turns it to short midwicket
pitches outside leg stump and it's short as well allowing Sangakkara to swivel and pull it to long leg
defended to point on the front foot
quicker ball slanting into the Silva who gets behind the line and blocks it solidly
no spin at all for Vettori, Silva comes forward and inside edges it to square leg
welcome back says Sangakkara! Outstanding shot! Sangakkara steps down the track, uses the angle into him, and smashes it over the infield and to the midwicket fence
defended back to the bowler
too short outside off stump, Sangakkara cuts hard but Hamish Marshall dives to his left at point and makes an excellent save
driven on the front foot to long off for a single
full ball, he was searching for the blockhole on that occasion but he needs to search a little harder, defended on the off side
good length ball on middle and leg stump, Silva plays back and defends to the leg side, Franklin picks it up on his follow through and shies at the stumps
worked off the pads to short fine leg
good length ball on middle stump, Sangakkara pushes to midwicket and wants the single, Silva sends him back because James Marshall was too quick
swept down to deep backward square leg for one
defended on the front foot, Silva is lookign to use his feet against Vettori
and he does so again! steps down and lofts to long-off, he didn't time that well, if he had it would have been swallowed up by the fielder at long-off
driven through covers for a single
good length ball angling into off and middle stump from over the wicket, Sangakkara plays forward and defends
driven to the fielder on the cover fence for a single, it's Peter Fulton who does the fielding
defended to point on the back foot
full ball on the pads, pushed towards midwicket for an easy single, there are a lot of gaps on the leg side whereas the off side is packed!
short of a length ball on off stump, Sangakkara waits for it on the back foot and chops it to point
slower ball on off stump, Sangakkara drives to Fulton on the cover fence&
driven straight back to the bowler but a mis-field allows the single, Vettori kicks the ground in disgust
pushed through quicker on off stump, the ball kicks off a good length and beats the outside edge
Silva tries to drive on the off side but gets an inside edge through midwicket for a single
worked off the pads to square leg for one more
tossed up ball outside off stump, Silva sweeps awkwardly to deep square leg
full outside leg stump, Sangakkara swivels and sweeps fine, he's timed that well enough to reach the fence, a poor way to end a fine spell from Vettori
Silva charges down the pitch to a short ball and flat bats it over McMillan at mid-on, that hit very high on the bat
cut hard at Marshall (I don't know which) at point, he stretches full length to his right and brings off an outstandign one-handed save
played down towards midwicket for a single
short ball outside off stump, Sangakkara pivots and pulls it to deep square leg for one
short ball angling into the pads, whipped through square leg for one, the batsmen think about two but Fulton's sprint in from the fence makes them decide against it
cut down to third man for a single to end the over
played to midwicket for a single
steered to point with an angled bat
shot! superb improvisation, Silva baks away to make room to one that's short, he slashes it past Marshall at point and finds the fence, that's his first boundary by the way
dabbed to short third man for one
good length ball outside off stump, Sangakkara gets forward on bended knee and drives to deep cover
good length ball outside off stump, Silva tries to pull it but misses
loud appeal for lbw but the umpire says not out, that pitched outside off stump, Sangakkara moved across and got hit on the pad, close shout but was the impact outside off, or did he get an edge?
driven to long on for a single
shrot ball outside off stump and Silva smashes it, absolutely smashes it, through midwicket for four, there was no chance of stopping that, he hit it very hard

Sangakkara is run out backing up too far! Silva drove straight back at Adams who stretched one hand out and got fingertips to it, the ball crashed into the stumps at the non-striker's end and Sangakkara was found short by the third umpire
good length ball slanting into the right hander, Silva plays forward and flicks it to short midwicket
pitches wide outside off stumpa dn moves away from the right-hander, Dilshan slashes but misses
defended back to the bowler on the back foot
worked off the hips through midwicket and Dilshan is off the mark
full ball on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
caught! Silva came forward and tried to hit that over the off side, he ended up slicing it to Marshall (tell you which one in a moment) at point, simple catch but what a wicket to get at this stage!
edged down to third man for one
pitches short of a length on leg stump, glanced down to fine leg, the batsmen sprint through for two
slower ball, excellent change of pace, that was in the corridor outside off stump and Maharoof went fishing but caught nothing
defended on the leg side on the front foot
full length ball on off stump, driven on the front foot to long-off for one
good length on off and midle stump, pushed to the vacant midwicket region for an easy single
fullish ball on off stump, defended back to Adams
short of a length ball outside off stump, cut to back ward point
fuller ball outside off stump, driven to deep cover for another single, New Zealand will not mid this, runs coming in ones and twos
driven firmly but straight back to Franklin
full ball outside off stump, Maharoof slashes at it and gets an edge over slip, it's racing away to the third man fence but Craig McMillan run across and saves it
bouncer, the batsman tries to hook but decides to pull out of the stroke
full ball outside off stump, Maharoof hits across the line and mis-times it to point
short fo a length ball on off and middle, Dilshan tries to heave it through midwicket but misses
dabbed to Vettori at cover for one
good length ball on off stump, no room to work with for the batsman, driven back to Adams on the back foot
driven past the bowler this time for a single
short of a length ball outside off stump, Dilshan plays a pre-meditated shot and a curious one, he got on the front foot and paddled that from outside off stump wide of the fielder at short fine leg
he does it again, but this time he finds the fielder at short fine leg
short of a length ball, not short enough to pull though and Dilshan's attempt fails
full ball on off stump, driven hard but to the fielder at cover
short ball again but this time Dilshan connects with the pull shot and gets a single to deep square leg
full ball on off stump, driven down the ground for one more
good length ball on off stump, played to cover on the front foot, this is excellent bowling at the death

caught at deep square leg! It was a loose ball, a full toss on leg stump, Dilshan could have smacked that anywhere and he hit it straight to Ross Taylor who was patrolling the fence, Gillespie finishes an excellent over, just two runs off it and a wicket too
bangs it in short first up and Vaas plays an unconvicing pull shot in the air to fine leg to get off the mark
angling into the pad s from a  good length, worked behind square leg for one
driven to deep cover for another single
good length ball on middle and off stump, heaved through midwicket for a single
finally they find the fence! full ball on off stump, a half-volley, Maharoof makes room by backing away and lofts over cover for four, welcome runs for Sri Lanka
driven down the ground for a single to long-on
fullish outside off stump, Maharoof exposes all stumps and tries to drive, but cant beat cover
shorter this time, banged in and moving into him, Maharoof makes room in an attempt to slog it over the onside, but ends up with an inside edge to McCullum diving to his left
speared in at a yorker length outside leg stump, Vaas swings at it and picks up a leg bye to short fine leg

and he gets the length all wrong, fires it in short of a good length outside off stump, allowing Maharoof to get under it and free the arms, and he smacks it down the ground, one, two, three bounces and over the ropes for four
yorker-length outside off stump, steered to backward of point for one
yorker-length outside off stump again, Vaas just manages to get the bat down and picks up one in front of point for a quick one
slower ball on a good length, Vaas guides it to point for one
yowza! Fullish outside off stump, Maharoof walks across his stumps and just picks it up powerfully, and sends it some 30 metres over the long-on ropes! Thats a terrific blow!
fuller outside off stump, again  Maharoof makes room and slogs across the line, but its all along the ground down to long-on and they settle for one
a low full toss outside off stump, and Vaas picks it very well and slams it just over Maharoof's head, and that screaches along the turf and beats long-off, four runs!
fired in quick on middle and leg, Vaas slogs to mid-on for one
a low full toss outside leg stump, Maharoof swivels but cant put it away, ends up with a leg bye around the corner as McCullum runs in

inn2.comm: good ball first up, bang on target, defended on the hop
lovely seam position, a jaffa! Pitched on middle and off, started to swing in, then found some away movement and had the batsman playing all around it
straighter one this time, Marshall behind it, pushing back to Vaas
full on leg stump, just marginally, and it swings down too much as it raps Marshall, Vaas asks the question but the umpire shakes his head, that ball swung late and looked to be doing too much
good, full delivery, Marshall gets behind the line and defends
strays to leg stump, and allows Marshall to neatly flick into the mid-wicket region and get off the mark
good length on the stumps, McCullum's behind it defending
just fractionally short outside off stump, and McCullum fiercely pounces on it, slapping it past backward point for the first boundary of the innings
marginally overpitched, and McCullum, in a flash, punches down the ground well wide of mid-off for four more, good shot
full again, this time McCullum just drops the soft hands on it and calls for the run as the ball scurries into the covers, good stuff
good length ball on the legs, and Marshall tucks it into the mid-wicket region for a couple
good length outside off stump, Marshall hops and drops the hands on it, and responds to McCullum's call for the single, and they get it with ease
fullish outside off stump, played into the covers for another quick single
fullish outside off stump, squaring him up and he gets an outside edge all along the ground through gully, well bowled
this one's straighter on middle and leg, Marshall works it to mid-wicket, where Silva dives fullstretch to his right and intercepts it, and Marshall hurries back to his crease
full and straight again, and Marshall defends back to Vaas
fractionally shorter this time outside off stump, he pushes it to point and takes a step down the track, but is sent back
strays down leg side, and Marshall clips off the pads to fine leg for one to retain the strike, umpire rules it as leg byes
fractionally wide of off stump, Marshall square-drives but gets an inside edge to backward point, and the run is cut off
straighter on middle and leg, pushed to mid-wicket and they set off, Maharoof from mid-on fires in a good throw, and that was a fairly rash single, the throw's just late and they get it anyway
quick on a good length outside off stump, defended into the ground hastily
good length outside off stump, again he's quick to defend to cover
fractionally shorter on leg stump, McCullum swivels and semi-pulls it down to fine leg for one
over-pitched on the pads, and Marshall wristily scoops that over mid-wicket and sends it away for four, top shot
short of a length outside off stump, McCullum drives off the back-foot and places it superbly in the gap at cover-point for four
strays down leg, McCullum comes on the frontfoot and whips it away to deep mid-wicket for a couple
full and wide, McCullum swings the bat at it and misses, Sangakkara fumbles the take
straight on off stump, he comes forward and defends
back of a length on the stumps, he shuffles and works it to mid-wicket
back of a length again, but outside off stump, McCullum backs away and punches it straight to point
short and wide, curt away down to Murali - wearing Jayawardene's pullover - at wide third man
on a good length just outside off stump, McCullum is squared up and plays all over it, rapped on the pads but that ball was always going over top of the stumps, they steal a leg bye in the process
good length delivery, Marshall gets forward and defends it on the off with a straight bat
good length on the stumps, Marshall gets behind it and defends
fractionally short and wide, and he cuts it wide of gully for one out to Murali at that wide third man position
a tad fuller outside off stump, and he pushes it to cover
full and wide, cracked off the frontfoot right to Dilshan at backward point
short of a length outside off stump, Marshall drops the soft hands on it and picks up a very sharp single as Dilshan swoops in like a hawk from backward point
overpitched on the pads, marginally so, and McCullum effortlessly flicks it high and handsome over deep backward square leg for maximum, all timing, nothing else
short and wide, and he's back in a flash, uppercutting through a vacant gully with those powerful hands, ball hurries out to Murali at third man on the bounce
full and swinging outside off stump, Marshall gets forward and drives loosely, getting beaten by the late movement and the angle
overpitched once more outside off stump, and this time Marshall's drive is weaker, as you could see a clear gap between bat and pad, and he's beaten on consecutive deliveries
full on middle and off, and McCullum flicks it right to Silva at short mid-wicket
fractionally short and wide, and McCullum crunches the back-foot drive in a flash, beating the packed off side field and picks up four more, shot of the innings, as far as I'm concerned
too full on leg stump, and McCullum flicks it wide of square leg in the gap, and picks up four more, not a good ball to bowl when the field is set for the off side shots
quicker delivery going down leg catches McCullum on the hop, he jumps and collects a leg bye down to third man
overpitched outside off stump, Marshall drives neatly but cant beat mid-off
short and wide, Marshall bring the hands down in an arc very quickly and gets it just past a diving Dilshan at backward point for one to third man, and the 50 is up for the hosts
good length on the stumps, Marshall gets behind the line and defends
fuller outside off stump, and thats textbook frontfoot defence from Marshall, James
too full, too wide, and too good a cover drive from Marshall, who plays it late and picks the gap extremely well, lovely shot
not as full this time,and Marshall defends back to Vaas
overpitched again and he drives straight to mid-off
back of a good length outside off stump, he gets behind it and defends
he oversteps first ball, its on the pads, and flicked around the corner for two, and thats three runs from no delivery!

gone! McCullum comes down the track to one pitched on middle and leg and swinging down, swings and misses, struck on the pads, Maharoof appeals and umpire Baxter lifts the finger. That looked like it was going to carry on down leg stump, according to the naked eye and Hawkeye, and McCullum can feel hard done by that one. Yep, he's livid as he walks off. A bad call.
good ball, full and swinging outside off stump, Taylor comes forward and plays at it, and gets beaten
too full on middle and leg, Taylor works it past mid-wicket for a couple to open his account
good ball! Pitches on a good length outside off stump, gets some lift and late movement, and Taylor just manages to withdraw the bat at the last minute
another good ball pitches outside off stump and leaves him, and he's beaten all ends up
fuller this time, swings in and leaves him as he plays across the line, closing the face of the bat, and the resultant edge falls just short of Sangakkara
fuller length delivery angling into the right hander, Marshall comes forward and flicks to mid-wicket for a single
full outside leg stump, Taylor comes looks to flick it, misses, but still collects one off the pads to square leg
back of a length delivery outside off stump, Marshall gets forward and defends
good length delivery outside off stump, Marshall opens the face of the bat and steers that to gully
half-volley outside off stump, Marshall leans into the shot and hits it over the infield and down to long-off for four
full and wide, again he goes after it but this time cant beat cover
good length outside off stump, defended back to Maharoof
slightly fuller, he comes forward and drives to cover for a sharp single
good ball, a beauty that lands on a terrific length just outside off stump and shapes away from his back-foot prob, he was all squared up by that ball
this one's straighter and doesnt move at all, and Marshall defends
too much width offered, and Marshall cuts off the front foot and dispatches it through point for four more
straighter this time, and he uses the soft hands to turn it square for an easy single and keep strike
too full outside leg stump, he looks to flick but ends up with a leg bye
straighter on the stumps, Taylor shuffles across and defends to the onside
too full on middle and leg, Taylor flicks to square leg for one
overpitched on leg stump again, and its flicked out to deep mid-wicket for one more
this one seams past his forward prod outside off stump and Sangakkara collects
full on middle and leg, Taylor reaches well forward and turns it through mid-wicket for one more
good, probing length outside off stump, Taylor comes forward and drops the hands on it, running it to point
straighter this time, and again Taylor plays over his pad and turns it to leg side
where did that come from? Banged in fractionally short outside off stump, and before you can blink Taylor slams it over mid-wicket and wide of mid-on for four
a better length this time, outside off stump, forcing Taylor to present the full face of the bat back to Maharoof
slower ball, nicely driven out to mid-off
slightly short in length outside off stump, and once again Taylor just picks it and swings it over mid-wicket for another boundary
flat outside off stump, he gets forward and flicks to mid-wicket, 'JUST ONE' is the call
fizzed up on off stump, he gets forward and turns it to the on side
quicker through the air, flatter too outside off stump, Taylor comes across and defends and gets rapped high on the pad
tossed up outside off stump, Taylor is forced to defend
flatter and faster on off stump, Taylor comes forward and flicks straight to mid-wicket
flatter trajectory this time, he goes back and works it right to mid-wicket again
full on middle and off, Marshall flicks right to short fine leg and sets off for the run, but Murali cant hit the stumps
a good length outside off stump, Taylor comes forward and mistimes the drive to cover
fractionally wide, too close to the body to be pulling though, and Taylor mistimes it out to square leg
back of a good length on off stump, he rolls the wrists in an attempt to manufacture runs, but cant time it well enough
overpitched outside off stump, he thumps the drive down the ground and Jayasuriya flings himself to his right from mid-off and saves runs, good stuff from the veteran
good length outside off stump, defended to the off side
tossed up outside off, thats the doosra, which Marshall picks and defends off the back foot

RUN OUT! Flat outside off stump, Marshall gets forward and pushes it to covers, where Dilshan moves across in a flash from point, picks and throws it back to Sangakkara, and Taylor is caught short of his ground, a great piece of athleticism from Dilshan gets the breakthrough for Sri Lanka
tossed up on middle and off, turned around the corner but right to short fine leg

quicker, fuller and flatter outside off stump, Fulton comes forward and plays all over it, thats some appeal from the Sri Lankans, a very good one, but umpire Davis reckons it was marginally outside the line, and meanwhile Fulton scampers a leg bye
flattish on middle and leg, spins away, Marshall comes on the frontfoot and looks to defend it, rapped on the pad
shortish delivery outside off stump, Marshall opens the face of the bat and steers it straight to the fielder at gully
good length outside the off stump, Fulton comes on the frontfoot and shoulders arms
short of a length and angling into Fulton, who goes backfoot and defends with an inside edge onto the pads
good length delivery outside off stump, Fulton shoulders arms
fullish delivery outside off stump, Fulton reaches for it and drives it to cover
good length delivery outsideoff stump, Fulton opens the face of the bat and steers it down to third man for a single to get off the mark
full and wide, Marshall has a swing at it but misses, Sangakkara lets out a muted appeal
tossed up on off stump, Fulton plays well in front of his front leg and works it to mid-on for one
flatter and spinning down leg stump, Marshall covers it and tries to flick, but misses
tossed up outside off stump, he sweeps on the length and picks up one to square leg
tossed up on middle and leg, Marshall sweeps it away to deep square leg for a single

Murali! Fired in quick and flat on and around off stump and spins in sharply, Fulton plants the front leg half-forward and plays all around it, they all appeal with vigorous gusto and umpire Davis raises the finger! You have to have a solid technique to survive against this bowler, cant just go thrusting the pad forward
flatter on leg stump, spins into him but he adjusts well and works it into mid-wicket for a first-ball single
fuller outside off stump, Vettori gets forward and pushes it to cover
fuller and moving away, Vettori drives and picks up a thick outside edge past the vacant second slip region for one down to third man
overpitched ever so slightly on middle and leg, and Marshall chips it just over Malinga standing back at mid-on, and he's lucky to pick up four for that shot
straighter on the stumps, Marshall drives to mid-wicket
good length ball on middle and off, a slower ball, swings in and Marshall drives with an inside edge back onto the stumps, Maharoof cant believe it
this one's a fraction shorter in length and Marshall chops it into the onside and harries through for one
too short, too wide, and Marshall has little trouble in spanking that in front of point for four
quicker and flatter going down leg stump, Marshall looks to work it fine but gets rapped, another animated appeal from the close-in cordon is turned down
fuller and flatter on middle and leg, flicked right to mid-wicket
quicker delivery outside off stump, Marshall gets forward and defends
flighted outside off stump, Marshall gets forward and looks to defend it, rapped on the pads but that was just outside off stump
now he moves around the wicket and tosses one up on off stump, which is defended back to him
short and wide, Vettori guides that to Dilshan at backward point
full on leg stump and its clipped into the square leg region for one
good, quick delivery on a fine length just outside off stump, Marshall defends to cover
full outside off stump, Marshall looks to drive to the off but closes the face of the bat and ends up with an inside edge to the on side
overpitched outside off stump, and Marshall cant time his square drive at all, the ball rolls to Dilshan at point
a fullish length, Marshall comes forward and drives right to the man at cover
tossed up outside off stump, Vettori sweeps to square leg for one, he likes that shot
moves around the wicket, tossed it up on middle and leg, Marshall picks him for one to mid-wicket
tossed up a tad quicker outside off stump, Vettori plants the foot forward and gets rapped on the pad
quicker and flatter, he defends uneasily
this is the doosra, except it lands outside leg stump and is called wide
tossed up outside off stump, and Vettori takes the aerial route with his preferred sweep shot, placing it well over mid-wicket for four
quicker delivery on leg, Vettori looks to sweep it away, misses it, rapped on the pads
short and wide, Marshall cant connect with the cut shot
too straight this time, and Marshall flicks it around the corner to Murali and calls for the two, and gets it comfortably too
good length outside off stump, driven right to cover
fractionally short, Marshall flashes the cut shot hard but cant beat Dilshan at backward point, well stopped there
a good length outside off stump, Marshall drives but mistimes it, and ends up chopping into the ground
he oversteps, thats a good length ball that tucks up Marshall but a freebie
short and wide, again he cuts but just cant beat a prowling Dilshan at backward point
tossed up, Vettori sweeps through square for one
flatter on mddle and leg, Marshall works it to short fine leg for a quick run
tossed up on off stump, Vettori comes forward and whips it through mid-wicket, Marshall pushes for two and they get it
tossed up again, this time Vettori cant time the sweep past short fine leg
pushed through outside off stump, Vettori thinks about playing at it but resists
tossed up, defended well this time
full and angling into the right-hander's pads, tucked around the corner for a single, that's his fifty
lofted wide of the fielder at midwicket for a single, that was in the air but in the gap

run out! Marshall dabs the ball to mid-on and takes off straightaway for a needless run, Malinga screams in, picks up the ball with one hand and scores a direct hit, Marshall is well short, Marshall is lightning quick between the wickets but that was a suicidal bit of running
defended to cover
short ball and down leg side, McMillan tries to flick but misses, wide called
short of a length outside off stump, hardly any turn for Jayasuriya and McMillan cuts to get off the mark
full ball on middle stump, quicker through the air, flicked to midwicket
slower through the air on leg stump, tucked away behind square for one
pitching outside leg stump and spinning across Vettori from over the wicket, flicked to short fine leg
swept behind square on the leg side for one
defended to midwicket on the front foot

done in by the doosra! What a dismissal! That pitched on middle stump and McMillan played for the offspin and closed the face of the bat, it was the doosra and it spun across McMillan and took the outside edge of the bat and Jayawardene took an easy catch at first slip
defended to point
swept to deep backward square leg for one
audacious shot to play off your first ball! He stepped down to the pitch of the ball and lofted it cleanly over long-on, Jayasuriya looks stunned and so was I!
defended back to the bowler
cut to point on the back foot
good length ball on off and middle stump, defended on the front foot
full ball angling into the pads, Vettori tries to flick but doesn't connect well, gets a single to fine leg
pitches short of a length on off stump, angling across the right-hander, Marshall drives to deep cover for a single
defended on the front foot to point
full and straight, Vettori was a touch too early on the drive, the bat turned in his hand as he played it back to Vaas
too full and too straight, Vettori whips it off his pads to deep midwicket
full on the pads again, Vettori flicks and times it well but hits it straight to midwicket, he'll be disappointed with that
slightly short of a length on midle and off, driven to long-on off the back foot
defended back to the bowler on the front foot
Vettori tries to sweep from off stump but misses, Jayasuriya appeals for lbw but the impact was outside off stump
chipped down to long off for one
tossed slower through the air on off stump, Marshall gets forward and defends to cover
dropped a touch short, Marshall plays back and cuts wide of the fielder on the point fence, the batsmen run two
defended to cover on the front foot
short of a length ball on off stump, defended on the back foot

bowled him, and how! That was an impeccable yorker at 144kmh, low full and swinging from middle and leg stump to hit the base of off stump, Vettori didn't stand a chance, I don't think many batsmen would have had a chance against that ball
the bouncer first up, Franklin hastily ducks out of the way
nope it's another short ball, Franklin swings it away to deep square leg
another yorker, this time the line is outside of stump, Marshall digs it out and looks for the single, Malinga sprints to collect the ball on his follow through
tossed up full on off stump, Franklin gets forward and drives to long-on
tossed up angling into leg stump, Marshall uses his feet to get to the pitch of the ball and drives to long on
flatter ball but the length is too short on middle and leg, flicked behind square for one
width offered outside off stump, Marshall waits for it and cuts deftly fine of the fielder at short third man, excellent running and they complete three
pushed to covers for a quick single
short ball on off and middle stump, Marshall backs away and cuts from his stumps through cover point for a single
full ball pitching on off stump and swinging into the right-hander, driven to cover point for one
the attempted yorker but the line is outside Franklin's off stump, dug out to cover for one
short of a length ball on off and middle stump, Marshall stands up tall and plays it down on the off side
beauty! Awesome yorker swinging into Marshall's middle stump, the batsman did exceptionally to dig it out, very well played
the bouncer follows the yorker, Marshall is up to it and swerves out of the way
full ball swinging ito off stump, it's in the slot for the drive and Marshall caresses it through covers, the batsmen run three
pushed to covers for a single
played wide of the fielder at point on the front foot for another single
tight line and length on off stump, defended on the front foot  to midwicket
dropped slightly short outside off stump, Marshall makes room and cuts past point
tossed up slower through teh air on off stump, Marshall uses his feet to step down and drive to long-off
defended to cover on the front foot, Marshall sets off for a run from the bowler's end but Franklin sends him back
slanted across teh right-hander from round the pwicket, pitchign on off and spinning back, played past point for one
full ball on the pads, flicked through midwicket for one
the doosra pitches on middle stump and Marshall prods at it and gets an outside edge behind square on the off side
defended on the front foot to point

the Sri Lankans roar an appeal for caugfht behind but the umpire is unmoved! Marshall pushed forward at one anglign across him and Sangakkara went up spontaneously, not sure if it took an edge, will get back to you on that one
played past point for a single to end the over
defended back to the bowler
pushed through midwicket on the back foot for a single
fullish ball angling into the left-hander's off stump, drifting the ball with the arm, defended on the front foot
Franklin plays a very late cut to short third man for one
tucked off the pads behind square for one
driven to long-off for a single to end the over
driven down to long off for one
defended on the front foot
pushed past Murali for a very risky single, mid-on sprints in and throws, had he hit Marshall would have been out
blocked on the front foot
poor ball, full ball on leg stump, Franklin sweeps and sweeps fine, he beats the fielder at short fine leg and the ball runs down to the fine leg fence
defended solidly on the front foot, New Zealand are looking more confident now, just one more over of Murali to go.
Marshall uses his feet to step down but ends up defending it back to Dilshan
drifts down leg side, clips the pad
a touch short on leg stump, Marshall plays back and pushes through midwicket for one
fullish ball on off and middle, Franklin uses his height to reach out for it adn closes the face to turn it through midwicket

caught and bowled on the second attempt! Marshall steps down the track, he isn't to the pitch of the ball but he tries to chip it past Dilshan, as the ball flies back to the bowler, Dilshan jumps up and parries the ball with both hands, he's quick to recover and grabs it with his right hand, crucial wicket!
defended on the back foot to midwicket
full ball on off stump, driven back past the bowler for a single
good length just outside off stump, defended to cover on the front foot
short of a length outside off stump, Adams plays it on the frotn foot with an open face, he pushes it wide of cover for one
defended on the front foot on the off side
half-volley outside off stump, Franklin leans forward and drives to long-off for a single
short of a length outside off stump, Adams waits for it and glances it to point
full and drifting into the left-hander, defended on the front foot
pushed to long on for a single
pitching short of a length outside off stump and going straight through, Adams pokes at it and gets beaten
flicked through midwicket for a single
dabbed in front of covers for another single
pushed flat through the air on off and middle stump, defended on the back foot
short of a legnth but the line is poor, on leg stump, Franklin flicks it easily off his pads for one
this time he drifts on to the right-hander's pads, worked through midwicket for one more
better line on middle and off stump, defended to point on the back foot
full and wide outside off stump, Franklin frees his arms and drives through covers for a single
good length on middle and off stump, Franklin waits for it and plays it to point with an angled bat
excellent shot! width offered outside off stump and Franklin plays a splendid square drive for four, poor bowling and sensible batting! That will take some of the pressure off
chipped down to long on for one
defended on teh front foot
pushed down to long on for another single
slow through the air on off stump, defended on the front foot
dabbed in front of poitn and the batsmen scamper through safely
thick outside edge to short third man
fullish length on leg and midle stump, Franklin drives through midwicket for a single
loud appeal for lbw is turned down, Adams pushed forward and was beaten all ends up, that was missing leg
Adams plays back this time and is hit on the pad, that was missing leg as well
and this time he's a goner! that pitched in line of middle and went straight through, Adams pushed forward and was hit lo on the pad in front off off and middle, it was pretty plumb
pushed through quicker outside off, Gillespie plays back and prods but gets beaten
and again, Gillespie fishes outside the off stump but the ball beats the outside edge once more, Murali's finished his spell and an excellent one it was too!
full ball on off stump, driven to long off for one, Franklin looks at ease out there
fullish ball on off stump, Gillespie closes the face and gets an outside edge to short third man
defended on the back foot but very unconvincingly
driven back to the bowler
defended to midwicket on the back foot, one more to go
played to cover on the front foot, just one run off the over, the asking-rate is slowly creeping up
full ball on middle and leg stump, flicked through midwicket for one
145 kmh and searching for the blockhole, he doesn't quite find it, Gillespie plays it back to the bowler
full ball outside off stump, Gillespie chops down at it and squeezes it wide of the fielder at third man, two valuable runs for New Zealand

oh ho, how did he keep that out! Malinga bowled the yorker full and fast, Gillespie backs away exposing all three stumps, the ball is heading straight for them but the bat comes down in the nick of time
sprayed wide outside off stump, New Zealand can tick of another run
Malinga bangs in the bouncer, Gillespie gets out of the way
pitches short of a length outside off stump, Gillespie backs away and wafts at it but gets beaten
good length on off stump, Franklin pushes it to point and gets a single, that's New Zealand's 200
Gillespie tries to slog it down to ground but gets a top edge over shrort third man, New Zealand run two, precious runs these
defended to midwicket
once again he tries to slog over  midwicket, it doesnt come off but they run a single
defended on the front foot
lofted back over Dilshan's head, Franklin adds two more to his tally which is now 33, it's been a very level-headed innings from him
tight line and length on off and middle stump, Gillespie blocks it on the leg side and they run a single
full ball on off and middle stump, Franklin drives to long-on and gets a single
full ball outside off stump, Gillespie drives at it but gets beaten
the attempted yourker on middle and leg stump, Gillespie does his thing, which is to move away and somehow keep it out
what's this? A full toss on middle and leg? Gillespie flicks it through midwicket for two runs
tight line on middle stump but Gillespie manages to turn it to square leg for one more
full ball outside off stump, Gillespie backs away and cuts, sort of cuts anyway, through the off side for a single
shot! Four invaluable runs through midwicket, Franklin smashes a half-volley off the back foot between midwicket and wide long on
another yorker, defended back to Malinga
another yorker fired into leg stump, Franklin gets an outside edge through mid-off for a single
Gillespie keeps out another searing yorker, he backed away and somehow keeps bringing his bat down in the nick of time, they run a single to point
driven down to long off for another single, Franklin keeps strike for the next over
full ball on middle and leg, Franklin drives superbly down the ground for two more, just five needed now
and again, played with an impeccably straight bat to long-on for two more
the attempted yorker is dug out to mid-on for a single, two needed by New Zealand
caught! Gillespie top-edges a high full toss to Maharoof at mid-off, he's played extremely well till now but perhaps he thought he could have finished it off with a single blow
he bowls a wide!! that was very wide outside leg stump and New Zealand are level!
defended to mid-on
bang in the blockhole, Franklin digs it out
full toss, defended back to the bowler
defended to cover
pushed to short fine leg, three left
high full toss, Mason swings and misses, pressure mounting
defended to mid-on, no run, unbelieveable stuff
MASON HAS DONE IT he takes a step down and lofts it straight back over Jayasuriya's head for four, New Zealand have won by one wicket off the last ball!
